Comments_List: How to think about evolution and systematics.

I learned a lot about vertebrate anatomy, evolution, and paleontology in general.  It was an incredibly interesting class, and we got a lot of hands on experience in lab with some of the most famous fossils that have been found.
Fantastic lectures, fantastic lab, dream class.

The course often ran past the time it was scheduled to end, by a great deal, which made it hard to schedule appointments after class, since sometimes lab even ran until after 8 pm (which meant no dinner in the dining hall as well).  The course itself was wonderful and I have no complaints.
Absolutely. Dr. Gauthier's illustrates the evolution of the vertebrates in the most engaging way.
Yes.  It is a very niche subject, which Yale happens to be one of the best at.  Jacques is also an incredibly accomplished paleontologist who is an amazing source of knowledge and experience.
